result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery Randall Westling

11:35 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Jeffery Randall Westling. Defendant Jeffery Randall Westling in court. Includes 22CF581, 22TR2671, 22TR2672, 22TR2673. Court reviews case. ADA Becker states discovery has been provided. Atty Chapman states discovery has been received. DE is currently serving sentence for OWI 4th and request to push out Plea. Court sets STC and PLEAS. Adjourned 11:40 AM
Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 24, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on January 12, 2023 at 08:30 am.

for Atty. Chapman to Appear Remotely at 10/12 hearing. Filed by Atty. Chapman. kma     to gl

FOR ATTY FEES. DE to pay $100/mo comm 9/1/22. PPF waived. DE signed Pet for Appt of Atty & will be mailed an Order for Pymt. Includes 22CF121 and 22CF581. kma

TO BE RECEIPTED TO 22CF121 ONLY UNTIL PAID IN FULL. ONCE PAID IN FULL, PAYMENTS TO BE APPLIED TOWARDS ATTY PPA ON 22CF581.
AMENDED. Signed by EFV on 915/22. Appointing Atty. Chapman; repayment rate of $100/mo commencing 10/1/22. kma
Scheduling Order. Signed by EFV on 09/07/22. arc
22R 012300.   Posted by C. Westling. olg
Filed by ADA Ballo. mw

AMENDED

 X SIGNATURE BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  X Surety
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1,750
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
SURETY NAME/S:  Cindy Westling

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. 

- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

3:15 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Jeffery Randall Westling. Defendant Jeffery Randall Westling in court, in custody.  INCLUDES 22CF581 (BBH), STC: 22TR2671, 22TR2672 and 22TR2673. Court reviews file. Atty. Chapman states that DE's mother is willing to co-sign bond. Court amends bond to cash bond and co-signature bond. Court sets STC, in person appearance. Adjourned: 3:42 PM. kma
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

8:41 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Daniel James Chapman appeared by video for Jeffery Randall Westling. Defendant Jeffery Randall Westling in court, in custody.. Includes 22CF581 ARGN, 22TR2671, 22TR2672, and 22TR2673. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Enter NG both counts and TR cases. Reserve on pre plea rights.  BBH 22CF581: Atty Chapman makes bond argument. ADA Ballo objects to bond modification. Court denies motion at this time. Court may consider co-signature bond with cash bond. Court sets BBH. Adjourned 08:49 AM
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on September 7, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Filed by Atty Chapman. arc

1:36 PM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Benoy    Defendant Jeffery Randall Westling in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jeffery Randall Westling.  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin.    INCLUDES: Preliminary hearing on 22CF581 and STC for 22TR2671, 22TR2672 & 22TR2673.   Atty Chapman states DF wishes to waive the PH.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Ballo states Information will mirror complaint.  BBH set with EFV 9/6/22. Arraignment to be heard at the same time.  Adjourned: 1:38
Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail Bond Hearing and Arraignment on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

12:59 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin.
